content:
KARI'S WINDOW TO THE WEB

LEARNING THE WEB

Name:Kari Rutan
E-mail: easu1510@ea.oac.uci.edu
Major: Social Science, Psychology

Three neat Web finds:

  1. ICS 1C is a great class with lots of good things and a chance to work with other students.
  2. I drew a K!
  3. Remember the light brite?

Questions I can now answer
  • How in the world of the world wide web does one create hypertext links within plain text to eventually create a beautiful HTM document?
  • How in the world of the world wide web can I get a weather report?
  • Do you like to Ski?
  • Learn all about targets and distractors in Social Sciences department of Cognitive Science (my major!)
  • Backgroud basics of an undergraduate major in Social Science at U.C.I.

  • About Hypertext...

     I must begin this with my personal definition and understanding of Hypertext. On entering ICS 1c I did not have a clue about what hypertext was. Hypertext,I have learned, is the way that normal people are allowed to use computers. What I mean by that is hypertext covers up all the messy computer commands that most people do not understand (like me before I took this course). Now when someone wants to write something on the computer, one needs to use all those messy commands (plain text). When people see what you have written they are looking at it in HTML (hypertext markup language)i.e., the pretty,clean stuff that we all see on Mosaic and the Internet. Now a link is merely how one makes those blue words that you click on that can send you from one document to another document. Please click on the highlighted markers in this article to get much more detailed information and directions on how to create your very own HTML document with links!

    Return to list of questions.

  • The weather...

     While looking for the weather in my favorite ski spot I happened to find several different weather reporting services. Curious about the weather in Florida? At this site you may view the entire state of Florida and then click on hi-lited cities for a current weather report. For weather all over the world all you need to do is hop onto the Weather Information Superhighway and choose just about anywhere in the world. Some sites include colorful satellite maps. You can then see for yourself how the weather system is acting and possibly predict your own weather forecast. My favorite so far is the local Oregon weather reports. Here you can hit the second `this' by local forecast and link into the University of Michigan's Weather Underground and receive information about many different cities in the U.S. Happy weathering!

    Return to list of questions.

  • Do you like to ski?

    Skiing happens to be one of my most favorite things to do in the whole world. When I found theSKIWEB I was pretty excited. Now I can look up current weather conditions if I'm planning a trip. I can also get current road conditions and lodging information. From the Rocky Mountains to Europe, it's all covered right here. One of my favorite spots to visit in the Web World isAustralia because I have not yet had a chance to visit there in the real world. They have a great map with satellite pictures and the works. Just give it a couple of minutes to download.

    Return to list of questions.

  • Learn about a special study in Cognitive Science..

     I have discovered that I can learn about what my professors are researching while they are here at U.C. Irvine. One interesting study that you can discover for yourself is by my Experimental Psychology profesor, Professor D'Zmura. You can `meet' him and all the other members of the U.C. Irvine Social Science faculty and find out about the research of other professors. His main research emphasis is in color and visual comprehension of color. This has a lot to do with understanding colorblindness. So...if everyone is telling you that your clothes never match when you think they do, D'Zmura's the man for you.

    Return to list of questions.

  • Information about becoming an undergraduate in the school of Social Sciences at U.C.I.

     Entering U.C. Irvine as a freshman was difficult. What made it even harder was the fact that I knew very little about my major. On the web one can find important information that introduces the new student or just an inquisitive one to the department ofSocial Sciences at U.C.I.As we have previously seen you can even meet the members of the faculty and communicate with them through e-mail. Pick a professor in an area that looks interesting and send them some mail. Professors are human, too, they love mail.

    Return to list of questions.

Submitted January 30, 1995 for ICS 1C
